New Records: India scored its highest T20I total of 297/6, behind Nepal's 314/3 against Mongolia last year
Key Match Events: Sanju Samson scored a 47-ball 111, his maiden T20I hundred, and a second-fastest T20I century by an Indian
Suryakumar Yadav and Sanju Samson shared a 173-run second-wicket stand off 70 deliveries
Riyan Parag and Hardik Pandya made merry after Samson and Suryakumar departed
Bangladesh had a complete meltdown in the 18th over when 'keeper Litton Das lobbed a throw over the bowler's head when both batters were stranded at one end
Post-Match Reflections: India swept the T20I series 3-0, and the Tests 2-0
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 24,000-odd spectators at the Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium got their money's worth as Samson and Suryakumar lit up the night with a blazing 173-run second-wicket stand
Wrist spinner Ravi Bishnoi, drafted into the XI in place of Arshdeep Singh, picked up three wickets
Others: Off the first ball of the Bangladesh reply, Parvez Hossain Emon was bounced out by Mayank Yadav
Litton (42, 25b) and Towhid Hridoy (63 n.o., 42b) shored up their individual tallies even as their team's cause was long lost
